data.name: HelpTextBox.Text
data.value:
Basic Controls
Left click the canvas to add a vertex, whether you have vertices drawn or not, the location of the click is utilized like a vertex. Left click elsewhere on the canvas to draw a straight line from the previously clicked point to the next.
Right click, hold and drag the mouse over the canvas to free draw; line size and color applies to free drawn content. Free drawn content is not affected by the polygonal content. Free drawn content cannot be filled or moved, and vertex size does not affect it.
Canvas size can be adjusted by rescaling the program window, but down-scaling will erase content that spans beyond the new borders, and up-scaling will not have the full canvas style applied unless it is then re-applied after up-scaling.
Getting Started
1. Choosing a canvas style should be the first step. Changing it later overwrites all but the currently selected polygon lines; this includes any free drawn items. Custom colors are selected by pressing the button to the right of the Canvas Style Drop-Down Menu and applied by selected a "Custom Color..." option from the menu.
2. Choose the line size for drawing content; this does not dynamically resize existing lines. Vertex points may be drawn and filled, just drawn, or transparent. Vertices are squares centered around the mouse pointer click location.
3. Select a line color. This applies to free-drawn and polygon lines, as well as vertices. Custom colors available.
4. Select a fill color. Click the fill button to apply the fill. It will only fill the currently selected polygonal area, but may be done multiple times to test colors. Fill is erased when lines are moved or a new canvas is chosen, but can be re-applied.
5. Start a New Shape. This button disconnects from any editing of the polygon lines/shape, allowing the user to begin a new polygon. Only click when fully done with current polygon. Not applicable to free-drawn content.
Optional
Moving Lines - Due to the nature of the program, moving will overwrite all but the currently selected polygon lines and the selected background. If the user wishes to not lose free drawn work or other content, do not use movement controls. The pixel move integer decides how many pixels the lines will move over when a direction is clicked. The directional buttons apply that integer to the lines once per click.
"Complete the Polygon For Me" - This button will draw the complete polygon over the currently selected lines with the selected line color. The line(s) drawn by the program to close the polygon does not count as a user-drawn line, and may be overwritten, but can be re-applied.
"Reset Canvas" - Clears the entire canvas of all content and resets the background to white.
